intro: Calliandra decrescens, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking red or orange inflorescences, which resemble flames and bloom throughout the dry season. The plant has compound leaves composed of numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Calliandra decrescens is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of fodder for livestock.
